results.title: masala tea powder, how to make masala tea powder or chai masala

steps.step: first grind the dry ginger.now grind the nutmeg and cardamom.store the simple and basic chai masala in an air tight container.firstly grind the dry ginger.then grind the nutmeg.finally grind all the rest of the herbs and spices with the already ground ginger and nutmeg.store in an air-tight container.use the chai masala whenever you make an indian chai.around ¼ tsp of chai masala is perfect for 2 cups of tea, but you can make it to ½ tsp for a more spicy indian chai.

extendedIngredients.name: bell peppers
extendedIngredients.original: 6 mini bell peppers, seeded and sliced into thin rounds
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 mini bell peppers, seeded and sliced into thin rounds
extendedIngredients.originalName: mini bell peppers, seeded and sliced into thin rounds

extendedIngredients.name: eggplant
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large eggplant, sliced in thin ¼” rounds
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large eggplant, sliced in thin ¼” rounds
extendedIngredients.originalName: eggplant, sliced in thin ¼” rounds

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.Line a large baking with parchment paper and mist with a non-fat cooking spray. Evenly spread out eggplants and pepper rounds. Lightly mist them with an olive oil mister or nonfat cooking spray, and then generously sprinkle with salt (I used about a 1 tsp and a half).Roast in oven until peppers and eggplants are cooked through and charred well, about 25-30 minutes. Flipping over once about halfway through.

Remove from oven and let cool four about 5 minutes.In a large bowl, combine the roasted eggplants and peppers with the remaining ingredients. Stir well to combine, and then store in an airtight container and refrigerate overnight.

steps.step: Pass carrots and ginger through a juicer; stir in lime juice.
Serve over ice.
Pass carrots and ginger through a juicer; stir in lime juice.
Serve over ice.
Pass carrots and ginger through a juicer; stir in lime juice.
Serve over ice.

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoon olive oil, plus more to garnish (optional)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoon olive oil, plus more to garnish (optional)
extendedIngredients.originalName: olive oil, plus more to garnish (optional)

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Spray a baking pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.Toss broccoli with 1 tablespoon olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and add to the baking sheet. Roast for 15 – 20 minutes, until broccoli has softened and browned. Rotate half way through.While the broccoli is roasting, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in a large sauce pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and shallot and saute until fragrant, 2 – 3 minutes.

Add the spinach, peas and liquid and bring to a boil, stirring constantly until spinach has thawed. Season with salt and pepper. Turn down to a simmer and cover.When broccoli is done, add to the pot and keep covered for another 5 minutes.
Remove the soup from the heat and, in batches, blend on high until smooth. Return to the pot, season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
Garnish with a drizzle of oil or chili flakes.

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: ¼ cup diced scallions, whites and greens
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup diced scallions, whites and greens

steps.step: Place the shredded cabbage and scallions in a large bowl.
Heat a medium dry skillet over medium-low heat.
Add nuts and let toast, stirring every 20 seconds or so, until the nuts are lightly browning.
Add to cabbage mixture.In a small bowl, whisk together the ingredients for the dressing.
Pour over the cabbage and toss until everything is well combined and cabbage is coated. Taste and add more salt if desired.
Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.

results.title: poori bhaji or batata bhaji – maharashtrian poori bhaji

steps.step: boil the potatoes till they are cooked completely.once they are warm, peel them and chop.in a pan, heat oil. add cumin, mustard and urad dal.fry till the mustard crackles and starts making sound and the urad dal begins to turn brown.add the chopped onion. fry till they become soft & transparent.now add the ginger and green chilies. fry for a minute.add the curry leaves. stir and fry for some seconds.add the turmeric and asafoetida. stir and fry for some seconds. don't burn the turmeric.next, add the chopped potatoes, half of the coriander leaves.stir. now add ¾ water and salt. stir and cover the pan.let the bhaji simmer for 5-6 minutes on a low flame.there should be some moisture in the bhaji and it should not be very dry.add the remaining coriander leaves.stir and serve batata bhaji hot with pooris, chapatis or dosa.

extendedIngredients.name: to

extendedIngredients.originalName: to ¾ cup chopped coriander or cilantro leaves

results.title: poori bhaji or batata bhaji – maharashtrian poori bhaji

steps.step: boil the potatoes till they are cooked completely.once they are warm, peel them and chop.in a pan, heat oil. add cumin, mustard and urad dal.fry till the mustard crackles and starts making sound and the urad dal begins to turn brown.add the chopped onion. fry till they become soft & transparent.now add the ginger and green chilies. fry for a minute.add the curry leaves. stir and fry for some seconds.add the turmeric and asafoetida. stir and fry for some seconds. don't burn the turmeric.next, add the chopped potatoes, half of the coriander leaves.stir. now add ¾ water and salt. stir and cover the pan.let the bhaji simmer for 5-6 minutes on a low flame.there should be some moisture in the bhaji and it should not be very dry.add the remaining coriander leaves.stir and serve batata bhaji hot with pooris, chapatis or dosa.

extendedIngredients.name: soy sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tbsp coconut aminos or soy sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tbsp coconut aminos or soy sauce

results.title: Broccoli Stem Noodles with Sesame Ginger Dressing

steps.step: Cut into noodles using a spiral vegetable cutter (alternatively, you could shave them using a carrot peeler).
Place noodles in a large mixing bowl.   In a small bowl, combine sesame oil, apple cider vinegar, coconut aminos or soy sauce, ginger, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes.
Drizzle over broccoli noodles and toss to combine.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
